page.title: 01Rothbury
page.content: Rothbury lies to the west of the A697 Morpeth to Wooler road, approximately 15 miles north west of Morpeth and 13 miles south west of Alnwick. In winter time some minor roads into Rothbury are blocked by snow but it is a very popular place in the summer. There is a wide range of accommodation for summer visitors including licensed premises, private homes and caravans. Rothbury is surrounded by beautiful hills and moorland and is the starting point for visits into the Coquet valley. There are ancient rock carvings and a fortified settlement on Lordenshaw, which is within walking distance, to the south of Rothbury. Cragside, a National Trust Property, lies just outside the village to the east.
